questions.question: What is the missing value in 5 + ___ = 9
A diver is 60 meters from the ocean surface. He descends 35 meters more. What is his total distance from the surface down to his current depth?
The temperature is -8°C in the morning. It increases by 15°C by evening. What is the temperature now?
A mountain climber starts at 1,250 meters. He descends 350 meters and then climbs 500 meters higher. What is his final elevation?
A small company reports a profit of Php 7,500. Then, they sell their assets for Php 12,300. How much money did they earn?
A submarine is 450 meters below sea level. It rises 300 meters and then descends another 200 meters. What is its final position?
A football team gains 12 yards on one play, loses 18 yards on another, and then gains 7 yards. What is the net yardage?
A blue whale eats 321 kilos of tiny shrimp the whole morning. Several hours later, it ate another 456 kilos of tiny shrimp. How many tiny shrimps did the blue whale eat?
A bank account starts with Php 500,000.00. Then, a withdrawal of Php 750,000.00 is made, followed by a deposit of Php 300,000.00. What is the final balance?
A hiker starts at -80 meters. She ascends 130 meters and then descends 60 meters. What is her final position?
The temperature is -25°C. It increases by 40°C during the day and drops by 18°C at night. What is the final temperature?
An investor loses Php 1,200 on one investment, gains Php 750 on another, and loses Php 500 again. What is the total change in value?
A plane is flying at 2,000 meters. It descends by 1,250 meters and then climbs 750 meters. What is its new altitude?
A person has a balance of Php 200. They deposit Php 4,500.00, then withdraw Php 2,000.00. What is their final balance?
A marathon runner starts at -90 meters below sea level, ascends 250 meters, and then descends 120 meters. What is her final elevation?
A stock drops by Php 250, increases by Php 400, and then drops by Php 300 again. What is the total change?
A person owes Php 800 to one lender, Php 500 to another, and Php 300 to a third. They pay back Php 900 in total. What is their remaining debt?
The temperature is 5°C. It drops by 8°C and then rises by 12°C. What is the final temperature?
An elevator starts on the 3rd floor. It goes up 10 floors, down 12 floors, and then up 5 floors. What floor is it on?
A government starts with a deficit of Php 5 billion. It earns Php 3 billion in revenue and then incurs PHP 2 billion in additional expenses. What is the new deficit?
A balloon is at 2,300 meters. It descends 700 meters, then rises 1,000 meters. Where is it now?
A factory loses Php 2,000, Php 1,800, and Php 1,500 in three consecutive months. What is the total loss?
A family spends Php 2,500 on rent, Php 800 on groceries, and Php 600 on utilities but receives a bonus of Php 1,500. What is the net expense?
A warehouse starts with 5,000 items. It ships out 2,750 items and receives shipments of 1,200 items. How many items are left?
A shark is swimming 200 meters below sea level. It dives another 150 meters and then ascends 100 meters. What is its depth?
A runner finishes a marathon in -10 seconds relative to the average time (faster). Then he loses 5 seconds in the next race (slower). What is the total difference from average?
The temperature in a city starts at -15°C in the morning. By noon, it rises by 12°C, and then by evening, it drops by 7°C. What is the temperature in the evening?
A hiker begins at -200 meters below sea level, ascends 350 meters, and then descends 150 meters. What is the hiker's current position?
A small business experiences a loss of Php 2,000 in January, a profit of Php 3,000 in February, and another loss of Php 1,500 in March. What is the business's total balance after these three months?
A player starts a video game with a score of -50 points. In the first round, they gained 120 points, but in the second round, they lost 70 points. What is the player's total score?
A family has a starting budget of Php 1,000. They spend Php 1,200 on a vacation but receive a Php 500 refund for unused tickets. What is their final budget balance?
When the signs are ______, subtract and copy the sign of the number with the ______ absolute value.
When the subtrahend is negative, change the subtraction sign to ______.
A submarine is at a depth of -50 meters and rises 20 meters. Where is it now?
A student had Php 450 but spent Php 300. What is their remaining balance?
The temperature was -10°C in the morning and dropped by 5°C. What is the current temperature?
A mountain climber was at 2,000 meters above sea level and descended 500 meters. Where are they now?
A bank account starts with P200, but P500 is withdrawn. What is the balance?
A car was traveling at 60 km/h and decelerated by 30 km/h. What is the new speed?
Zyler owed Php 400 but has paid Php 250. How much does he still owe?
A diver is at -30 feet underwater and rises by 40 feet. What is their position?
The elevation of a valley is -100 meters, and a hiker climbs up 70 meters. What is their elevation?
On a number line, you are at 5. Subtract 10. Where do you land?
A warehouse started with 1,000 boxes of supplies. 450 were shipped to a client, and another 120 were reported as damaged. How many boxes are left?
A student solved 20 problems but forgot to submit 5. How many were actually completed?
A classroom had 25 pencils, but 10 were lost. How many pencils are left?
The event started with 500 students. 120 left early, and 80 more arrived late. How many were present at the end?
A company had a loss of Php 500 but recovered Php 300 later. What is the net status?
The school library had 300 books. They loaned out 150 books and received 25 books as donations. What is the current number of books in the library?
A student scored -15 points on a quiz due to penalties but earned 25 points from extra credit. What is their final score?
A class started with 40 students. By midyear, 12 students transferred out, and 5 new students joined. What is the current class size?
An employee was assigned 50 tasks for the month. They completed 35 tasks but received penalties for 5 incomplete tasks. What is their adjusted task completion rate?
An office budget started with Php 10,000. They spent Php 7,500 and incurred unexpected expenses of Php 1,200. What is the remaining budget?
A school library had 400 books. 90 books were borrowed, and 50 were overdue and not returned. How many books remain in the library?
A student's initial score was 40. They lost 15 points for incorrect answers and gained 10 points for extra credit. What is their adjusted score?
A classroom had 100 notebooks. Over the semester, 35 were distributed to students, and 20 were misplaced. How many notebooks are left?
A class of 50 students had 8 students absent on Monday and another 12 absent on Tuesday. What is the total number of students who attended on both days?
Out of 120 students, 25 failed their first test, but 15 retook the test and passed. How many students still need to pass?
An office started with 300 chairs. 75 were moved to a new office, and 25 were damaged and unusable. How many chairs are still available?
A project had a budget of Php 25,000. They spent Php 18,750 and incurred an additional Php 4,000 in overruns. What is the total budget left?
An employee is entitled to 20 vacation days per year. They used 12 days in the first half of the year and 5 days in the second half. How many vacation days remain?
A business earned Php 50,000 in revenue in January but incurred Php 35,000 in expenses and gave Php 5,000 in refunds. What is the net revenue for January?
A teacher had 120 markers. After lending 45 markers to another class and losing 30 during a move, how many markers remain?
What is the product of 6 x 3 = ?
What is the product of 9 x 13 = ?
What is the product of 8 x 2 = ?
What is the result of (-5) x 6 x (-3)?
Find the product of 7 x (-8) x 2.
What is the result of 9 x (-3) x (-2)?
Find the product of (-4) x 10 x (-3).
What is the result of 8 x (-6) x 3?
What do you get if you multiply (-3) x 6 x (-4)?
What is the result of 5 x 6 x (-2)?
Find the product of 7 x 3 x 4.
What do you get if you multiply (-6) x (-4) x 5?
What is the result of (-2) x 6 x (-5)?
Find the product of (-6) x (-7) x (-2).
What is the result of multiplying (-3) x 8 x (-2)?
Calculate the product of (-8) x (-7) x 2.
What do you get if you multiply (-3) x (-6) x (-4)?
What is the result of 5 x (-2) x 10?
What is the product of 10 x (-4) x 5.
What is the result of 8 x 4 x 5?
Find the product of 12 x 5 x 4.
A submarine descends 12 meters per minute for 15 minutes. What is the total depth?
A factory produces 8 defective items every hour for 24 hours. What is the total number of defective items?
A vehicle moves backward -9 kilometers per hour for 18 hours. How far has it travelled?
A penalty of -25 points is given for every wrong answer. If there are 12 wrong answers, what is the total penalty?
A mountain climber descends -14 meters every hour for 10 hours. What is the total descent?
A balloon rises 15 meters per minute for 8 minutes. What is its position?
The temperature drops -7°C per hour for 16 hours. What is the total temperature drop?
A debt of -100 pesos is paid for 20 days. What is the total payment?
A bank deducts -45 pesos every week for 13 weeks. What is the total deduction?
A hiker loses -30 meters of elevation every 6 minutes. How much elevation does he lose after 18 minutes?
A diver descends -9 meters every second for 12 seconds. What is the total depth?
A company incurs a loss of -120 pesos per day for 25 days. What is the total loss?
A delivery truck moves backward -50 meters every minute for 15 minutes. What is the total distance moved?
The temperature drops -5°C every hour for 30 hours. What is the total drop?
A bank account is charged -200 pesos per transaction. If there are 18 transactions, what is the total charge?
A hot air balloon ascends 20 meters every minute for 6 minutes. What is the final position?
A climber gains 18 meters every hour for -7 hours. What is the total gain?
A ship moves backward -12 kilometers every hour for 9 hours. What is the distance covered?
A machine produces 36 items per hour. After 4 hours, how many items were produced?
A submarine descends -80 meters per minute for 14 minutes. What is the total depth?
A spacecraft moves -1,500 km/h for 6 hours. What is the total distance covered?
A worker earns -45 pesos per day for 20 days. What is the total salary?
A plane descends -400 feet per minute for 5 minutes. What is the total descent?
A hiker loses -25 meters of elevation every 10 minutes. What is the total loss after 50 minutes?
A tank drains 60 liters of water per hour for 8 hours. How much water was drained?
A team loses 12 points per game for 22 games. What is the total score?
A train reverses -75 kilometers per hour for 3 hours. How far did it reverse?
A factory produces 500 defective items per week for 10 weeks. What is the total defective count?
A diver ascends 15 meters every -3 seconds. How much depth did he gain?
A climber ascends 50 meters per hour for -8 hours. How much elevation did he gain?
The company has 5,760 employees. If the company divides them into departments such that each department has 24 employees, how many departments does the company have?
A school orders 28,800 pencils and wants to divide them equally into 72 classrooms. How many pencils will each classroom receive?
A food distribution center packages 5,400 meals every day. If each package contains 36 meals, how many packages does the center prepare each day?
A warehouse stocks 50,400 items. If they are arranged into 8 rows of equal numbers, how many items are in each row?

A car manufacturer produces 18,000 vehicles per year. If the company operates 300 days each year and produces the same number of vehicles every day, how many vehicles does the company produce per day?
A tree planting organization plants 120,000 trees each year. If they plant the same number of trees every month, how many trees are planted each month?
A shipping company delivers 24,000 packages per week. If each delivery truck can carry 480 packages, how many trucks are needed to deliver all the packages in one week?
A team of 18 workers can finish a project in 72 days. If the team works at the same rate, how many workers would be needed to finish the project in 36 days?
A bookstore receives 72,000 books per month. If each shelf can hold 40 books, how many shelves are required to display all the books received in a month?
A chocolate factory produces 24,000 chocolate bars in a day. If the factory operates for 20 hours, how many chocolate bars does it produce per hour?
A farmer harvested 24,000 kilograms of rice. If he wants to pack the rice into 150 bags equally, how many kilograms of rice will each bag contain?
A university enrolls 12,000 students each year. If the university divides students into 40 classes of equal size, how many students are in each class?

A manufacturer produces 96,000 units of a product per month. If the company works 24 days a month and each worker produces 50 units per day, how many workers are required to produce all the units in one month?
A university enrolls 15,600 students each year. If the university divides students into 40 classes of equal size, how many students are in each class?

A manufacturer produces 84,000 units of a product per month. If the company works 28 days per month and each worker produces 60 units per day, how many workers are required to produce all the units in one month?
A factory produces 31,500 units of a product every month. If the factory operates 25 days per month, how many units does the factory produce per day?
Ninety-six people have been invited to a birthday party. The caterer is arranging the tables. Each table can accommodate 8 persons. How many tables are needed?
The library has 22,500 books. If the library wants to arrange them into 75 shelves, how many books will each shelf contain?
A bus can hold 80 passengers. If there are 20 rows of seats in the bus, how many seats are in each row?
A construction company builds 8,400 houses every year. If the company works 200 days per year, how many houses does the company build each day?
Mico's scores during the Mathlympics Da Math Competition are as follows: +5, -8, -3, +13, +20 and -9. What was his average score?
A submarine has descended 2,160 meters in 18 minute. After 18 minutes. If it descends at a constant rate, how many meters does it descend per minute?

Fe baked 200 cookies on the first day, 140 on the second day and an additional 150 cookies on the third day. She divided them equally into packs containing 14 cookies per pack and sold each pack for Php 30. How much did Fe earn in three days?
A delivery service makes 16,800 deliveries every month. If each driver is responsible for 280 deliveries per month, how many drivers are needed to make all the deliveries?
During the Citywide Sports Competition, Liza received the following scores in her events: +6, -4, +5, +10, and -2. What was her average score?
A shipping company delivers 160,000 packages per year. If the company delivers 13,500 packages every month, how many packages are delivered each day?
In a certain barangay, there are 3,000 food packs to be distributed to the victims of the earthquake. If there are 600 households in the barangay, how many food packs will each household receive?
A factory produces 64,800 units of a product every month. If the factory operates 20 days each month, how many units does the factory produce per day?

Alex just received his grades for the first semester in five subjects. His grades are as follows: 90 in Math, 91 in English, 88 in Science, 94 in Filipino, and 87 in MAPEH. What is Alex's average grade for the semester?
A school enrolls 12,000 students. If the school wants to divide the students into 50 classrooms equally, how many students will be in each classroom?
